thread.title: Model claims Justin Bieber has a 'small d***' before partying on his luxury yacht
thread.title_full: Model claims Justin Bieber has a 'small d***' before partying on his luxury yacht

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Model claims Justin Bieber has a 'small d***' before partying on his luxury yacht
text:
Model claims Justin Bieber has a 'small d***' before partying on his luxury yacht Stunning model Sharah Fitzgerald previously slated the size of the star's manhood Share Justin Bieber Sharah (Photo: Instagram/Getty) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
An Australian model who slated Justin Bieber for the size of his manhood partied with the star on his luxury yacht last week. 
Blonde beauty Sharah Fitzgerald was on board the boat during the Canadian pop star's eventful tour Down Under while he enjoyed a break on an exclusive island in Queensland. 
She was joined by sister Kaysha Louise on the $2,200-an-hour vessel, but she previously took a swipe at the singer on Instagram and claimed he has a "small d**k". Sharah (l) partied on the yacht (Photo: Instagram/kaysha_louise) 
The model shared the rant in a scathing message comparing both his and Mark Wahlberg's Calvin Klein campaigns. 
Sharah wrote: "Bieber looks like [he] just left church [and] stuck some transfer tats on to compensate [for] his small d**k and glorious 12-year-old body!" 
It was posted in 2015 - but it's not likely she'd be invited back if Bieber finds out about the post. She criticised his Calvin Klein ad (Photo: justinbieber/instagram) Don't listen to her, Justin (Photo: ChinaFotoPress via Getty) 
His father Jeremy tweeted: "@justinbieber what do you feed that thing. #proud daddy (sic)" He's been defended by fans, friends and even family in the past (Photo: Splash) 
His personal-trainer Patrick Nilsson also previously claimed Justin was "well-endowed" despite reports his Calvin Klein underwear campaign had been photoshopped to give him a bigger package. 
He said: "I can definitely confirm that he is a well-endowed guy. I sound weird saying that, but yes." Like us on Facebook
